peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I identify old bottle markings?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Marks At The Base The base of a glass bottle is one of the most important indicators of its age. Antique glass bottles often feature unique markings on the bottom, such as pontil marks or manufacturer logos. These glass bottle markings can help you identify the bottle's origin and age.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Can You Tell How Old a Glass Bottle Is - Roetell

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there an app to identify old bottles for free on iPhone?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The Selinko mobile app is free and available on Google Play and the App Store. To identify your bottle, simply download the Selinko app on your smartphone and scan the NFC chip located on the back label.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Identify and authenticate your bottle - Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to determine the age of an old bottle?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It is true that the mold seams can be used like a thermometer to determine the approximate age of a bottle. The closer to the top of the bottle the seams extend, the more recent was the production of the bottle.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Bottle Dating - Society for Historical Archaeology

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can you tell what year a bottle is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Most bottle manufacturers molded the year into the glass at the bottom of the bottle in 2-digit format. You'll often find it in the lower right portion when looking at the bottom (some dates are much easier to distinguish than others).
